title: Relationship & Attachment Patterns
description: Discover your interpersonal friction points, attachment sensitivities, and how you naturally respond to emotional proximity.

questions.text: When someone I care about seems distant or quiet, my immediate internal reaction is...

options.text: To assume they are busy or tired.
To wonder if they are upset with me.
An intense need to ask 'what's wrong' to regain comfort.
Complete panic that they are preparing to leave me.

insight_cloud.title: Attachment Security
insight_cloud.text: How we handle baseline relationship friction often traces back to our earliest attachment patterns. Seeking proximity or clarity during conflict is a strong indicator of a secure relational foundation.

questions.text: When a partner or close friend wants more intimacy, time, or emotional disclosure than I am used to, I feel...

options.text: Comfortable adjusting or communicating my limits gently.
A bit pressured, but I try to meet them halfway.
Suffocated; I instantly want to pull away or create physical distance.
Angry and trapped; I usually shut down or push them away entirely.

questions.text: In the middle of a heated conflict with someone important to me, my instinct is to...

options.text: Take a breath and try to understand their point.
Get defensive, but I usually circle back to apologize later.
Lash out verbally to ensure they feel my hurt.
Walk out, disappear, or threaten to end the relationship.

questions.text: How do you generally view your own worthiness of love and support?

options.text: I inherently deserve care and respect.
I struggle with self-worth, but I know logically I am deserving.
I believe I have to constantly earn love through over-giving.
I deeply believe I am fundamentally unlovable or broken.

insight_cloud.title: The Urge to Pull Away
insight_cloud.text: Sometimes, creating extreme distance during conflict feels like the only way to survive it. This is a common protective adaptation, often learned in environments where emotions were invalidated or unsafe to express.

questions.text: Have your emotional reactions or fears caused you to remain in an actively harmful or abusive situation?

options.text: No, I am able to leave toxic dynamics.
I have stayed too long in the past, but I am learning boundaries.
Often; the fear of being alone outweighs the harm of staying.
Yes, I am currently unable to leave a situation that feels unsafe.
